intro: Boucerosia hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish broom. It is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula, characterized by its yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. It has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Boucerosia hispanica is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
